alert.note: Alert for Anne Arundel; Calvert; Charles; Prince Georges (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 01 at 4:17PM EDT until July 01 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... South central Anne Arundel County in central Maryland... Northwestern Calvert County in southern Maryland... Southeastern Prince Georges County in central Maryland... Northeastern Charles County in southern Maryland... * Until 500 PM EDT. * At 417 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Marlton, or near Clinton, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. * Locations impacted include... Clinton, Rosaryville, Marlton, Dunkirk, Brandywine, Huntingtown, Owings, Baden, Aquasco, Lower Marlboro and Cheltenham. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.

area.areaDesc: Anne Arundel; Calvert; Charles; Prince Georges
